basics.name: Elle Miller
basics.label: PhD Student
basics.summary: Inspired and self-directed PhD student equipped with 8 years of academic and industry experience. My aspiration is to create intelligent systems that benefit individuals and society.

work.name: DLR Institute for Robotics and Mechatronics
work.summary: Researched unknown object grasping for assistive robotics.

work.name: NASA Jet Propulsion Laboratory
work.summary: Researched robotic perception for hazardous terrains.

work.name: SLMC Research Lab, University of Edinburgh
work.summary: Integrated a dual-armed torso robot with an omnidirectional mobile base to create EVA.

work.name: Max Planck Institute for Astronomy
work.summary: 1 of 5 interns to be selected internationally, embarked on a 1+ year research project that resulted in a first-author MNRAS publication.

education.name: University of Edinburgh
education.position: PhD Student | Robotics and Autonomous Systems CDT

awards.title: Best Talk at Annual Edinburgh RAS CDT Conference
awards.summary: Received an award for giving the best student lightning talk in my PhD programme.

awards.title: Engineering Student Industry Placement Scholarship
awards.summary: The University of Sydney 2021 candidate to be selected by NASA JPL to undertake an extended research placement.

awards.title: Dean's Excellence in Academic Performance
awards.summary: Awarded to high performing students who achieve an average mark of a High Distinction or greater.

awards.title: Sydney Scholars Award
awards.summary: Awarded to outstanding and all-round students who demonstrate leadership skills in the school and community.

awards.title: Proxime of Secondary School
awards.summary: Ranked in top 0.6% of 55000+ students in 2016 HSC, with an ATAR of 99.60.

volunteer.summary: Offer support and friendship to children in fostercare.
Help out at weekly social nights for adults with disabilities.
